;Autumn River Xiaowang

;[Tang Dynasty] Pi Rixiu
;The vast lake and sky are blue, and one star is flying like a white egret.
;At this time, let go of your hopes and never get tired of being a wanderer.
;

;Translation and annotations

;

;

;;Translation
;;At dawn, the sky is clear and the water is clear. The lake and the sky contrast with each other like a piece of crystal jasper. A soaring egret adorns it.
;This scene makes me feel more open-minded and refreshed. If I go boating on this autumn river, I will never get tired of it.

;

;;Notes
;;One star: This refers to one.

;

;

;About the author

;

;

;
;;
;
;Pi Rixiu, with the courtesy name Ximei and Yishao, was born between 834 and 839 AD and died after 902 AD. He once lived in Lumen Mountain. He called himself Lumenzi, and also called Mr. Jianqi Buyi and Zuiyin. A writer and essayist in the late Tang Dynasty, he is as famous as Lu Guimeng and is known as "Pi Lu" in the world. Today, he is from Tianmen, Hubei ("Beimeng Suoyan"), Han nationality. In the eighth year of Xiantong (867), he passed the Jinshi title. In the Tang Dynasty, he served successively as military judge of Suzhou ("History of Wu and Yue"), Zuo Lang, Dr. Taichang, and deputy envoy of Piling. Later, he participated in the Huangchao Uprising, or was said to be "trapped among thieves" ("Tang Caizi Biography"), and served as a Hanlin bachelor. After the failure of the uprising, he disappeared. The poems and essays are both novel and simple, and most of them are works that sympathize with the sufferings of the people. "New Book of Tang·Yiwenzhi" records many volumes of "Pi Rixiu Ji", "Pi Zi", and "Pi Shi Lumen Jia Chao".

;Chinese Valentine's Day in Hanzhuang Zhazhou

;[Qing Dynasty] Yao Xie
;Mulan Paddle and Lotus Root Flower Village, after singing, the hall is red and the air is cool in the evening.
;Outside the smoke, outside the water of Liusi Lake, the mountain brows are blue and the moon's eyebrows are yellow.
;

;Translation and annotations

;

;

;

;Introduction

;

; This poem combines the beauty seen at Hanzhuang Gate with the beautiful folklore of Qixi Festival It not only describes the beauty of Weishan Lake, but also integrates the love myth of the Cowherd and the Weaver Girl, making the poem more poetic.

;

;Appreciation

;

; Hanzhuang Gate is located at the mouth of Weishan Lake in Weishan County, Shandong Province. Chinese Valentine's Day, the seventh day of the seventh lunar month every year, is the day when Altair and Vega meet. It is a beautiful folk legend. The author took a boat with magnolia trees as oars and went boating on Weishan Lake, known as the "Land of Lotus Roots". At this time, the singing on the boat stopped from afternoon to evening. The weather on the lake is slightly cool, and the willows are shrouded in light smoke, which is reflected in the quiet water. The green distant mountains are like ripples in the water, just like eyebrows; the pale yellow moon is also curved and high, like a beautiful eyebrow. "The mountain's eyebrows are blue and the moon's eyebrows are yellow" is a very good sentence. It refers to the mountains and the moon of Weishan Lake as "eyebrows". They face each other from a distance, and it is vaguely visible that the Cowherd and the Weaver Girl are "encountering each other" and expressing affection with each other's eyes.

;

;About the author

;

;

;
;;;
;Yao Xie (1805-1864) was a writer and painter in the late Qing Dynasty. The courtesy name is Meibo, the nickname is Fuzhuang, and he is also known as Dameishanmin, Shanghusheng, Uncle, Dashanmin, Fuweng, Fudaoren, Yeqiao, Donghaisheng, etc. He is a native of Zhenhai, Zhejiang (now Beilun, Ningbo). Daoguang raised people and taught through his writings for life. His scholarship covers classics, history, geography, Buddhism, drama, and novels. He is good at poetry and painting, especially figures and plum blossoms. He is the author of "Textual Research on Jinle", "Collection of Dameishan Pavilion" and "Ci of Shuyinglou".
